intro: Antholyza, commonly known as the "false lily-of-the-valley," is a genus of flowering plants in the family Asparagaceae. It consists of several species, most notably Antholyza amplexicaulis, which is native to southern Africa. The plant features grass-like leaves and small, fragrant, white or greenish flowers that bloom in clusters. It is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Antholyza is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in challenging conditions.
